title: [Large-scale] Augmented Reality-based Elementary English Vocabulary Learning Program: Application of Scientific Inquiry Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Recognition of basic English alphabet and 100 everyday vocabulary words, experience designing simple experiments and formulating hypotheses
context.additional_context: Blended learning via BYOD (tablet/smartphone): twice-weekly 40-minute face-to-face classes + daily 15-minute AR self-study. Learning data is systematically measured/recorded for scientific analysis, with evidence-based feedback provision.

learning_goals: Develop scientific inquiry skills by manipulating 3D objects in AR environments and contextually utilizing 25 new vocabulary terms per week.
Analyzing word meaning-pronunciation-spelling-image connections with 80% accuracy through an augmented reality quiz system to enhance variable control capabilities
Sharing AR word maps with peers in collaborative learning mode to generate and record observational results of over 10 situational expression sentences

resources: Vocabulary curriculum mapping document for teachers
AR marker kit for students (printable materials)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
